required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PARTNER: Panitumumab Added to Regimen for Treatment of Head aNd Neck Cancer Evaluation of Response
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Controlled, Phase II Trial of Combination Chemotherapy With or Without Panitumumab as First-line Treatment of Subjects With Metastatic or Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer, and Cross-over Second-line Panitumumab Monotherapy of Subjects Who Fail the Combination Chemotherapyâ€¦

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label, 2-arm, controlled, phase 2, multi-center, estimation clinical trial of docetaxel and cisplatin combination chemotherapy with and without panitumumab in the first-line treatment of subjects with metastatic or recurrent head and neck cancer, as well as a cross-over second-line panitumumab monotherapy of subjects who fail the chemotherapy only arm. This study will be conducted in the United States. Approximately 150 subjects with histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic and/or recurrent SCCHN.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the First-line Treatment Phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
primary_outcome.description: The time from the date of randomization to the date of first disease progression determined by the investigators per modified RECIST v1.0, or death within 60 days after the last evaluable tumor assessment or randomization date (whichever is later) during the first-line treatment phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) During the First-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
secondary_outcome.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (SLD) of target lesions from baseline; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR. An overall response of CR or PR must be confirmed at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. ORR is the percentage of subjects with an overall response among the analysis population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Disease Control (RDC) During the First-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
secondary_outcome.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (SLD) of target lesions from baseline; Disease Progression (PD), >=20% increase in the SLD of target lesions from nadir; Stable Disease (SD), Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. An overall response of CR or PR must be confirmed at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. A best overall response of SD requires a visit response of SD or better no earlier than 35 days after randomization. RCD is the percentage of subjects with a best overall response of CR, PR or SD among the analysis population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DOR) During the First-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated only for the subset of subjects who have an overall response of CR or PR while on first-line treatment phase (subsequently confirmed at least 4 weeks thereafter), and is defined as time from the first CR or PR to the first observed disease progression by a modified RECIST v1.0. Subjects not meeting the criteria for progression by the analysis data cutoff date will be censored at their last evaluable disease assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Response (TTR) During the First-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of randomization to the first CR or PR during first line treatment phase (subsequently confirmed at least 4 weeks thereafter)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) for the First-line Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of randomization to the date of death during the entire study

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Second-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 57 months
secondary_outcome.description: The time from the first dose of panitumumab monotherapy to the date of first disease progression determined by the investigators per modified RECIST v1.0, or death within 60 days after the last evaluable tumor assessment or the second-line first dose date (whichever is later) during the second-line treatment phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) During the Second-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 57 months
secondary_outcome.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (SLD) of target lesions from baseline; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR. An overall response of CR or PR must be confirmed at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. ORR is the percentage of subjects with an overall response among the analysis population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Disease Control (RDC) During the Second-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 57 months
secondary_outcome.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (SLD) of target lesions from baseline; Disease Progression (PD), >=20% increase in the SLD of target lesions from nadir; Stable Disease (SD), Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. An overall response of CR or PR must be confirmed at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. A best overall response of SD requires a visit response of SD or better no earlier than 35 days after the first dose date in second-line treatment. RCD is the percentage of subjects with a best overall response of CR, PR or SD among the analysis population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DOR) During the Second-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 57 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the first CR or PR to the first observed disease progression by a modified RECIST v1.0. Subjects not meeting the criteria for progression by the analysis data cutoff date will be censored at their last evaluable disease assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Response (TTR) During the Second-line Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 57 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the first dose of panitumumab monotherapy to the first CR or PR during second-line treatment phase (subsequently confirmed at least 4 weeks thereafter)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) for the Second-line Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the first dose of panitumumab monotherapy to the date of death during the entire study

clinical_study.condition: Metastatic or Recurrent Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic and/or recurrent Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck (SCCHN) determined to be incurable by surgery and/or radiation therapy.
- Measurable disease by CT scan
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance score of 0 or 1
- Age: 18 years or older
- Adequate hematologic, renal, metabolic, hepatic & thyroid function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior systemic treatment for metastatic and/or recurrent SCCHN
- CNS metastases, or nasopharyngeal carcinoma
- History of interstitial lung disease
- History of another primary cancer
- Any co-morbid disease that would increase risk of toxicity
- Active infection requiring systemic treatment
- Prior anti-Epidermal Growth Factor receptor (anti-EGFr) antibody therapy

reference.citation: Wirth LJ. PARTNER: a study of panitumumab plus chemotherapy for first-line treatment of advanced head and neck cancer. Commun Oncol. 2008;5(Supp 14):1-4.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled from 29 January 2007 to 1 September 2010.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The planned number of subjects to enroll was 110. The actual number of subjects enrolled was 113.

participants_list.participants: Subjects in this arm do not have second-line treatment period

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the First-line Treatment Phase
outcome.description: The time from the date of randomization to the date of first disease progression determined by the investigators per modified RECIST v1.0, or death within 60 days after the last evaluable tumor assessment or randomization date (whichever is later) during the first-line treatment phase.
outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants < 70 years of age who provide informed consent and receive at least one dose of first-line treatment (chemotherapy and/or panitumumab)

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the First-line Treatment Phase
measure.description: The time from the date of randomization to the date of first disease progression determined by the investigators per modified RECIST v1.0, or death within 60 days after the last evaluable tumor assessment or randomization date (whichever is later) during the first-line treatment phase.

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio is presented as panitumumab plus chemotherapy:chemotherapy alone.

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) During the First-line Treatment Phase
outcome.description: Per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0) for target lesions and assessed by MRI: Complete Response (CR), Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR), >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (SLD) of target lesions from baseline; Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR. An overall response of CR or PR must be confirmed at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. ORR is the percentage of subjects with an overall response among the analysis population.
outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks until disease progression or death, up to 67 months
outcome.population: all randomized subjects < 70 years of age who provide informed consent and receive at least one dose of first-line treatment (chemotherapy and/or panitumumab), with at least one uni-dimensionally measurable lesion at baseline using a modified RECIST v1.0 per investigatorsâ€™ review

measure.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) During the First-line Treatment Phase

An overall response of CR or PR must be confirmed at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. ORR is the percentage of subjects with an overall response among the analysis population.

analysis.estimate_desc: With Mantel-Haenszel weights within strata defined by randomization factors recorded in the IVRS
Calculated from a logistic regression model with treatment indicator and randomization factors (recorded on the CRF) as covariates

reported_events.time_frame: The time frame for adverse event reporting is from the first dose date to 30 days since the last dose date of the first-line treatment. The median time frame is 4.5 months for Panitumumab Plus Chemotherapy arm and 4.4 months for Chemotherapy Alone arm.
reported_events.desc: The table of Other Adverse Events summarizes the most frequent non-serious occurrences of adverse events.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
